content: spiral socks fancy cozy colourful begin at the heel and quickly wirk your way up the leg and down to your toes fun to make even more fun to wear 1 this spiral sock is worked with two colours from the middle of the heel in an in- creasing spiral after that we work the leg and the foot most of the sock is worked in double_crochet double_crochet or linked double_crochet ldc it is best to get familiar with those stitches before trying them on this sock there are plenty of great tutorials on youtube materials º 3 5 crochet hook º 2 sceins of light worsted yarn 3 or 100g/310m if you are european i used a yarn with a recommended hook size of 4-4 5 º 4 stitch markers prefereably in two different colours º scissors º a needle to weave in the ends abbrevations ●chain - chain ●single_crochet - single_crochet ●half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet ●ldc - linked double_crochet note ●fsc - foundation single_crochet ●slip_stitch - slip_stitch on the material ●fphdc - front post half_double_crochet ●bphdc - back post half_double_crochet i also did these socks with sock ●bpsc - back post single_crochet yarn which is much lighter i used a ●cs - crab stitch optional slightly smaller hook but sticked to ●st - stitch/stitches the pattern in general the only thing you will need to adjust is the lenghth of the chain around your foot af- ter you jave finished the heel so feel free to experiment with different wools and needles 2 heel this sock is worked from the heel in a spiral it is actually the most difficult part but once you have mastered the heel the rest of the sock will work up in no time i used linked double crochets for the heel because they give a firm texture to the whole thing unlike the holes you usually have when you make ●normal● double crochets note a round is closed when the last stitches of the two colors are on opposite sides of the circle round 1 form a magic_ring with color a this will be the color used on the leg of your sock chain 1 *into the magic_ring 1 single_crochet 1hdc 1 double_crochet put a marker in that first single_crochet you will need it in the next round picture 1 now remove your hook and pull the loop to make it bigger and prevent opening up again we will switch to colour b now 1 2 3 attach your colour b to the magic_ring now repeat what you did with color a chain 1 1 single_crochet 1 half_double_crochet 1 double_crochet don●t forget your marker in the single_crochet picture 2 in total you have 6 st pull tight the magic_ring picture 3 from now on we will crochet in linked double crochet i recommend watching some youtube-video first and get familiar with that stitch 3 round 2 switch to color a *in the marked single_crochet of color b 3 ldc pla- ce marker in
